    • Method Detail

      • saveUser

        @RequestMapping(method=POST,
                path="/users/new",
                produces="application/json")
public Message saveUser​(@RequestBody
                        User user)
        Saves a new user into the database.
        Parameters:
        user - - The user being added.
        Returns:
        - The Net-ID of the user being added.

      • getAllUsers

        @RequestMapping(method=GET,
                path="/users")
public java.util.List<User> getAllUsers()
        Gets a list of all the users in the database.
        Returns:
        - A list of all the users in the database.

      • findUserByemail

        @RequestMapping(method=GET,
                path="/users/findBy_email/{email_address}")
public User findUserByemail​(@PathVariable("email_address")
                            java.lang.String email_address)
        Very important "helper" method. Finds the respective user corresponding to the NetID being entered in.
        Parameters:
        email_address - - The NetID of the user we are looking for.
        Returns:
        - The user corresponding to the NetID, assuming that it exists.

      • getFirstNameByEmail

        @RequestMapping(method=GET,
                path="/users_email/{email_address}")
public java.lang.String getFirstNameByEmail​(@PathVariable("email_address")
                                            java.lang.String email_address)
        Primarily for testing purposes. Gets the 'First Name ' column from the respective user.
        Parameters:
        email_address - - The NetID of the user who we're checking the code from.
        Returns:
        userCode - The code of the user.

      • verify

        @RequestMapping(method=POST,
                path="users/verifies")
public Message verify​(@RequestBody
                      Verify verify)
        When the user enters the code on the app and hits submit, it will both enter the entered_code into the database and check if the entered_code matches the code. If so, then the user is "verified".
        Parameters:
        verify - - The class for input of pass and email
        Returns:
        Verified or not

      • verify_U

        @RequestMapping(method=POST,
                path="users/verify")
public Message verify_U​(@RequestBody
                        Verify verify)

      • updateName

        @RequestMapping(method=PUT,
                path="users/update/name/{email_address}/{new_first_name}")
public Message updateName​(@PathVariable("email_address")
                          java.lang.String email_address,
                          @PathVariable("new_first_name")
                          java.lang.String first_name)
        This function is used to update the database of the user table with the updated field. So like in this The first name of the user is being changed
        Parameters:
        first_name - - The first_name of the user who we're checking the code from.
        email_address - - The emailID of the user who we're checking the code from.
        Returns:
        The new updated name.

      • updatePhoneNumber

        @RequestMapping(method=PUT,
                path="users/update/phone_number/{email_address}/{new_phone_number}")
public Message updatePhoneNumber​(@PathVariable("email_address")
                                 java.lang.String email_address,
                                 @PathVariable("new_phone_number")
                                 java.lang.String phone_number)
        This function is used to update the database of the user table with the updated field. So like in this The Phone_number of the user is being changed
        Parameters:
        phone_number - - The emailID of the user who we're checking the code from.
        email_address - - The emailID of the user who we're checking the code from.
        Returns:
        The new updated phone_number.

        @RequestMapping(method=DELETE,
                path="users/delete/{email_address}")

        This function would be used to delete the user from the databse with the given email_address

                path="/user/findBy_ID/{id}")

        This is a very important method. This wold return the user associated with the particular ID.
